caption.p: Respiratory syncytial virus infection in an infant. The prototypic infantile respiratory virus, RSV, causes a lymphocytic bronchitis and bronchiolitis. ( a) This bronchus demonstrates a cuff of lymphocytes in the submucosa (H&E, 200×). ( b) Circumferential lymphocyte infiltrates are also noted in the small airways (H&E, 100×). ( c) Bronchiolitis may be accompanied by an interstitial pneumonitis, characterized by interstitial widening by lymphocyte infiltrates. Syncytial-type multinucleate cells are absent or rare in lung tissues from otherwise healthy infants but are characteristic of the viral cytopathic effect seen in culture in the diagnostic virology laboratory (H&E, 100×)
